snippet: Tyrone Howard, who is accused of fatally shooting Officer Randolph Holder in East Harlem this week, was allowed to enter a rehabilitation program but failed to show up.
abstract: Tyrone Howard appears in New York State Supreme Court before Justice Patricia Nunez, who informs Howard she will sentence him in October for drug charges unrelated to his fatal shooting of New York City Police Officer Randolph Holder; Nunez had opted to put Howard in drug-treatment program rather than in prison, but he failed to show up; killing has sparked debate about handling of his earlier case and risks of drug-treatment programs.
lead_paragraph: Tyrone Howard, who is accused of fatally shooting Officer Randolph Holder in East Harlem this week, was allowed to enter a rehabilitation program but failed to show up.

headline.print_headline: Judge Says Suspect in Officer’s Death Faces Prison for Violating Plea in Drug Case
headline.main: Judge Says Man Charged With Killing Officer Faces Prison for Violating Plea Deal in Drug Case
